theory.intro.oldText: <par>The whole idea of Step-Wise is to solve complicated problems <term>Step-Wise</term>: break them down into smaller pieces which are a lot simpler to tackle. To show you how that works, we first tackle two simpler tasks: adding numbers and multiplying them. Afterwards we merge these skills into a more involved skill.</par>
theory.intro.latestText: <par>Yet another basic skill is the skill of adding numbers. This is our last step in preparing for combined skills.</par>

theory.addNumbers.latestText: Adding numbersIn this skill you have to add two numbers. It's a tutorial - you're allowed to use your calculator - but see if you can do without.When calculating a sum, for instance , you can do the following steps.First add the two rightmost numbers. So becomes . The latter digit - the - shows the rightmost digit of our result.Then add the two second numbers. So becomes . This is the second digit of our result. Except: if our first digit was or more (which in our example it was) then we carry over that and add it here. So we'd get here.Merge the two results together to get the final result: .Try it out yourself!

theory.multiplyNumbers.oldText: <head>Multiplying numbers</head><par>In this skill you have to <term>multiply two numbers</term>. When multiplying small numbers, people usually do so from memory. As a child you learned what <inline-math/> is. You don't recalculate it every time. You simply know it's <inline-math/>.</par><par>If you really can't remember what a multiplication is, then feel free to use a calculator. This is a tutorial after all! But do remember the result, for if it ever comes up again later!</par>
